movesets.name: Life Orb Attacker

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Crunch is Mightyena's main STAB move as it has respectable Base Power and is very reliable. Sucker Punch mitigates Mightyena's low Speed stat and can pick off weakened foes after a Moxie boost. Play Rough gets great coverage alongside Mightyena's Dark-type STAB moves and hits Fighting-types that attempt to switch in, along with Dragon-types such as Druddigon, though Iron Tail can be used instead of Play Rough to hit Fairy-types like Aromatisse while also hitting Rhyperior. Fire Fang breaks through bulkier Steel- and Grass-types and has nice coverage all around.

Set Details

The listed EVs give Mightyena maximum offensive potential. Adamant is the preferred nature of choice over Jolly because Mightyena is quite weak and needs as much power as it can get. Life Orb adds to this, making Mightyena much more powerful with the ability to switch moves. Expert Belt can bluff a choice item, but the power loss is very noticeable. In a similar vein, Black Glasses can be used so that Mightyena does not have to take Life Orb recoil and also boosts its Dark-type STAB moves.

Usage Tips

Mightyena is best saved for late-game after the opponent's team has been weakened, and thus, should not try to sweep early game. Mightyena has to watch out for priority, as it does not have the bulk to live any. Bulkier Pokemon must be weakened before Mightyena is sent out so it can sweep later on. Be wary when using Sucker Punch because if the opponent predicts Mightyena is using it, it gives them a free turn.

Team Options

Wallbreakers make for good partners because they can soften the opponent's team; such wallbreakers include Choice Specs Delphox. Mightyena greatly struggles against bulky Fairy-types like Aromatisse, so ensure that they are removed with a partner such as Escavalier. Cleric support is needed as Mightyena is very prone to status, making Aromatisse a good partner that can also pass Wishes to keep Mightyena healthy. Fairy-types, in general, have good synergy, as they can handle Fighting-types for Mightyena. Hazard support is needed as this greatly aids in wearing down bulkier teams; thus, Rhyperior and Crustle are good partners.

movesets.name: doge

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Sucker Punch is a strong priority move that allows Mightyena to mitigate its somewhat low Speed. Crunch is another STAB move, which might seem a bit redundant, but it is much more reliable than Sucker Punch and the better option versus slower Pokemon. Play Rough gets great coverage all-around, hitting Fighting-type switch-ins and other Dark-types. Fire Fang is useful because it 2HKOes Pawniard and nails Ferroseed.

Set Details

Maximum Attack and Speed investment allows Mightyena to be as fast and powerful as possible. Investing in bulk is unwise because Mightyena's bulk is fairly pitiful, and if it invests in bulk, it is often too weak and outsped by many other Pokemon. Life Orb increases Mightyena's power, although Lum Berry is viable to avoid a crippling Will-O-Wisp or Toxic. Adamant is the nature of choice because it increases Mightyena's power, which it so desperately needs. A Jolly nature is not advised because nothing notable is outsped and this leaves Mightyena missing a lot of power.

Usage Tips

Mightyena is a very simple Pokemon to use: use the appropriate coverage move to hit its foes super effectively. Don't attempt to sweep too early because Mightyena is too weak to sweep entire teams by itself. Mightyena should wait until its teammates wear down the opposing team until Mightyena has a shot at sweeping. Do not keep Mightyena in on bulkier Pokemon; it's not powerful enough to break through them. Finally, be very careful when using Sucker Punch, as the opponent might use a status move or set up a Substitute.

Team Options

Sticky Web helps to make up for Mightyena's somewhat lacking Speed and allows an easier time for it to sweep; Pokemon such as Kricketune and Leavanny can both set up Sticky Web and take Fighting-type moves that threaten Mightyena. Pokemon that can wear down the opposing team such as Magmortar, Electivire, and Pangoro also make for good partners. Sawk has decent synergy with Mightyena and is a very powerful wallbreaker. Entry hazard support from Crustle and Omastar is great to wear down bulkier Pokemon throughout the match. Granbull is also a good partner, as it has good defensive synergy with Mightyena, can spread paralysis, and can keep Mightyena status-free with Heal Bell.

moves.name: Assurance
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe takes damage in the same turn, before the attack hits.

moves.name: Astonish
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bite
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Covet
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Crunch
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Embargo
moves.description: Item use is prevented for five turns.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fire Fang
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch. 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Heal Bell
moves.description: Cures status on the user's team.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Howl
moves.description: Boosts Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Hyper Voice
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Ice Fang
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch. 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Incinerate
moves.description: Removes the target's Berry.

moves.name: Iron Tail
moves.description: 30% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Leer
moves.description: Lowers target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Me First
moves.description: Uses the foe's attack at 1.5x power. Must be faster to work.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Odor Sleuth
moves.description: Blocks evasion modifiers. Allows Fighting- and Normal-type moves to hit Ghosts.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Play Rough
moves.description: May lower the target's Attack stat by 1.

moves.name: Poison Fang
moves.description: 30% chance to inflict bad poison.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Retaliate
moves.description: Power doubles if the user's teammate fainted the previous turn.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Roar
moves.description: Forces a switch to a random Pokemon.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sand Attack
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Scary Face
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snarl
moves.description: Lowers target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Spite
moves.description: Lowers the PP of the move used last by 1-5.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.description: The user always moves first. Will only work if the foe attacked.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.description: Does damage equal to half the foe's current HP.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.description: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thunder Fang
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch. 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.description: Repeats for 2-5 turns. No Pokemon can sleep during these turns.

moves.name: Yawn
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep after 2 turns.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: Lowers the foe's Attack by 1 stage. Decreases wild encounter rate.

abilities.name: Moxie
abilities.description: Boosts Attack by 1 stage if the wielder knocks out another Pokemon.

abilities.name: Quick Feet
abilities.description: Increases Speed by 50% when afflicted with a status condition.
